content: Would just like to note that Computer Science descended from Mathematical Logic and is actually considered a branch of Pure Math today. So the similarities are not coincidental. Moreover, math can (and often does) invent new realities. Think of modelling n-dimensional spaces. This is both modelling reality for n=3, and at the same time inventing new realities for which n is not equal to 3.
author: Mohammad Alaggan

content: Points taken, Mohammad. However, even though some mathematicians do consider Theoretical Computer Science as a branch of mathematics, I don't think that this is the majority view yet.
author: Luca Aceto
